instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1989: What is A1989? A1989 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2018, 2019 with EMC 3124, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00850..
definitions.A1990: What is A1990? A1990 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2018, 2019 with EMC3215, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01041, 820-01814..

threads.title: Replace <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> T2 to <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message: Hello is it possible to use the T2 of an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> on a logic board of an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> obviously paying attention to the capacity of the T2 and ssd
